item.description:
Nate and Sally will discuss the what they learned last month at the Plone European Symposium in Sorrento, Italy and the Plone Symposium East at Penn State. If there's time and interest, Nate can talk about Banjo -- a super-cool, web-based tool, for making Deliverance rules to theme a Plone site.

Directions and Parking: Betahouse is a 5 minute walk from the Central Square Station on the Red Line. If you're driving, the Green Street Garage on 260 Green St. is even closer, and costs the unbeatable price of $1/hour. http://tinyurl.com/mu... [googlemap]

About the Meetup: The Boston Plone User Group holds regular meetings on the fourth Thursday of the month. Come, meet, and mingle with your Boston Plone peers. We (users, designers and developers) gather monthly to talk about how we're using Plone, share knowledge and give demos of cool Plone products.

Can't make the meetup? View our ustream instead.

About Plone: Plone is among the top 2% of all open source projects worldwide, with 200 core developers and more than 300 solution providers in 57 countries. The project has been actively developed since 2001, is available in more than 40 languages, and has the best security track record of any major CMS. Find out more at plone.org.
item.how_to_find_us: At the door, ring the buzzer for betahouse
item.name: The Boston Plone July Meetup
